ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The course helped me develop Modern Greek through a very practical and conversational approach while also providing an enriching background in cultural comparisons.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: One strength of the course is that with a smaller class size, we are able to work a lot on speaking and conversations, which is the most important, and often most difficult, part of learning a language. The work load is effective and very manageable. The only weakness I can think of is the way the course book sometimes teaches grammar, and would benefit from a slightly less usage based approach and more of a chart and rule based one.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend the course as it fostered very comfortable development and use of the language, and I left every class very engaged and happy.
